DOC.brief_summary: This 2 arm study will assess the efficacy and safety of Avastin in combination with irinotecan + 5-fluorouracil/folinic acid, versus irinotecan + fluorouracil/folinic acid alone, as first line treatment in Chinese patients with metastatic colorectal cancer. Patients will be randomized 2:1 to receive 6-weekly cycles of Avastin (5mg/kg iv every 2 weeks) + irinotecan 125mg/m2 iv / leucovorin 20mg/m2 iv / fluorouracil 500mg/m2 iv weekly for 4 weeks, or 6-weekly cycles of irinotecan 125mg/m2 iv / leucovorin 20mg/m2 iv / fluorouracil 500mg/m2 iv weekly for 4 weeks. The anticipated time on study treatment is until disease progression, and the sample size is 100-500 individuals.
DOC.brief_title: A Study of Avastin (Bevacizumab) in Combination With Chemotherapy in Chinese Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer.
DOC.criteria: adult patients, >=18 years of age; histologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the colon or rectum, with metastatic disease; >=1 measurable lesion; ECOG performance status of <=1. prior systemic therapy for advanced or metastatic disease; adjuvant or neoadjuvant treatment for nonmetastatic disease in past 6 months; other malignancy within past 5 years, except cured basal cell cancer of skin or cured cancer in situ of cervix; clinically significant cardiovascular disease in past 6 months.
